p: At 25 Â°C, the time required for a 99% reduction in reagent-grade water was 22 d for transmissible gastroenteritis virus (TGEV) and 17 d for mouse hepatitis virus (MHV). In pasteurized settled sewage, a shorter time (9 d for TGEV and 7 d for MHV) was needed for a 99% reduction.These data suggest that contaminated water is a potential vehicle for human exposure[ 36].
